p: The most important bioactive components are the flavonoids and essential oil constituents ( Tschiggerl and Bucar, 2012). Sotiropoulou et al. (2020) have studied by LC-MS aqueous chamomille extracts. The major phenolic compounds were rutin trihydrate, ferulic acid, chlorogenic acid, and apigenin-7-O-glucoside. The optimum extraction temperature was at 80Â C with maximal antioxidant activity and the highest total phenolic content, which is coherent with its traditional use in teas.
